name: Baymont Inn and Suites - Southfield/Detroit

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I have stayed at his hotel twice recently when I lost power because it is nearby and accepts pets. One the first visit I noted that the room and bathroom seemed very dated. One my second visit, in another room, an inspection revealed a very dated room with barely working air conditioning. There were stains on the furniture and carpet. The bathroom was also very old and dingy. The towels are threadbare. There are no closets in this hotel (at least in the 2 rooms I stayed in) only a wardrobe, which is small. Even though this hotel is less than $100/night (barely), I would stay elsewhere next time.
reviews.title: Need updating-badly!

reviews.text: We were in Detroit to see a Lion's game and stayed at the Hampton. It was easy to find and only about 16 miles to downtown Detroit. The room was clean and had a good size bath. The breakfast had eggs, bacon, french toast stix along with the usual cold offerings too. The staff was very friendly and made check in easy. We would stay again. Close to numerous restraurants.

reviews.text: We have stayed here many times over the past several years, but it seems to have declined in the past year. The breakfast is still free, but the quality of some items has declined and there are fewer choices. The rooms are old and need refreshing. The cleaning is OK but not as spotless as it used to be. Another sign - there used to be a big bowl of free apples in the lobby, day and night; now they're gone. A manager told us there was no ownership, which might explain things. We're beginning to branch out and try other hotels in the area.
reviews.title: Not as good as it used to be

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Still has free wireless internet in all the rooms, which is good to see.
reviews.title: The Best Hampton We've Ever Visited

reviews.text: In contrast to the bad experience we just had at the Holiday Inn in Gatineau, Quebec, we were delighted to arrive at this Hampton Inn. The staff here exemplifies service, and their friendly, willing attitudes reflect people who seem to genuinely enjoy their jobs. The pool here was above and beyond most motels in its quality. And here's a surprise lagniappe: rather than putting out the traditional warm cookies, a staff member brings a cart every evening to every room. The guests then choose a beverage and a snack from the cart. Great location--great service--great amenities. Thank you, Hilton/Hampton Inns!
reviews.title: Pleasantly Surprised

reviews.text: I was in town for the Lions-49ers game and was looking for a decent hotel to stay at that was near Ford Field. Unfortunately the reviews I read on the hotels in the downtown Detroit area were not that great and the only safer option I had was to stay in Greek town, which is quite pricey.
reviews.title: Decent night at the Hampton

reviews.text: Nevertheless I found the Hampton Inn in Southfield, which is about a 25 min drive to Detroit. Overall the experience was great. The lady at the front desk was polite, the room was very clean and larger than I expected, the price was great and there was free parking.

description: Enjoy the comforts of home at our Baymont Inn & Suites Southfield/Detroit hotel. Located just off Interstate 696, discover convenient access to the best dining, attractions and shopping that the Southfield, MI are has to offer.Kick start your day with a workout in our fitness center and then fuel up with a free continental breakfast. Stay connected to what’s important with free Wi-Fi internet access. Go for a swim in our indoor pool and spa, then stop by our business center to finish up any work you may have. We also offer onsite meeting and conference space as well.
